core.userGoalStatement: As the Global Talent Acquisition Leader, I architect a future-ready workforce—building diverse, skilled teams, aligning external hiring with internal mobility, and delivering measurable value to the business.
core.coreBelief: Strategic, skills-based talent acquisition—powered by ethical AI, robust analytics, and systemic DEI—is a critical business driver and risk mitigator.
core.contentImplication: Frame all content around shaping a future-ready, diverse workforce and proving TA’s strategic ROI through data, AI governance, and inclusive practices.

items.Description: Integrating global workforce planning with skills-based hiring to meet long-term business objectives.
Upskilling globally dispersed TA teams in data literacy, AI tools, and consultative partnership.
Managing a complex partner portfolio—vendors, universities, RPOs, mobility & L&D—to build resilient pipelines.
Deploying and governing AI-driven, compliant TA tech stacks for efficiency, bias mitigation, and candidate experience.
Showcasing authentic EVP, DEI progress, and ESG impact to attract values-driven talent.
Delivering predictive insights and business-level metrics (quality-of-hire, retention uplift, cost avoidance).

responsibilities.contentImplication: Each asset should hook into at least one of these strategic responsibility areas.

items: Global labour-market intelligence & demographic trends
Advanced TA technologies, AI ethics & governance frameworks
Skills taxonomies and internal talent marketplaces
Data-driven DEI strategies and bias-mitigation techniques
Employer branding, ESG & candidate-experience design
Predictive analytics, talent intelligence and ROI modelling
International employment law, pay-transparency & AI regulation
Tech-stack integration and change-management best practices
knowledge.contentImplication: Demonstrate Korn Ferry expertise in at least one domain to build credibility.

items.Finding: 50% of employees are actively or passively job-hunting; global Net Employment Outlook +25%
items.Leverage_Point: Position TA as a proactive, intelligence-driven competitive moat that secures scarce skills ahead of rivals

items.Finding: Compensation & job security top priorities; hybrid flexibility gap >40 pts
items.Leverage_Point: Align EVP and flexible work policies with market expectations to widen pipelines

items.Finding: Only 28% believe companies achieve DEI goals; bias persists across hiring funnels
items.Leverage_Point: Showcase data-driven, bias-detection frameworks and inclusive sourcing to unlock innovation

items.Finding: 99% of TA teams use AI, yet 55% feel under-trained; new AI laws emerging
items.Leverage_Point: Provide explainable-AI tools, governance playbooks, and up-skilling to turn risk into advantage

items.Finding: 80% of firms aim to use predictive analytics in HR by 2025
items.Leverage_Point: Embed talent intelligence to forecast skill gaps and de-risk growth initiatives

connectionOpportunities.contentImplication: Lead with these proof-points to create instant relevance and urgency.

items: Delivering diverse, future-ready talent that fuels growth & innovation
Proving TA’s strategic ROI to the C-suite with hard data
Creating an ethical, transparent candidate experience that amplifies brand trust
Embedding predictive analytics for agile, risk-aware hiring decisions
Championing continuous learning & capability-building within TA
motivations.contentImplication: Position solutions as enablers of these motivations.
